solution.text:
Area of the segment = area of the sector(pqs) - area of the \(\bigtriangleup \) opq
Now area of the sector =\(\pi \times r^2 \times \frac {60}{360}\)
Now area of the sector =\(_{{trunc(pi_val*k*k*1/6,2)}}_\)
To find the area of \(\bigtriangleup\) opq, we draw a perpendicular on pq
We know that op=oq and \(\angle \) otp=\(\angle \) otq=\(90^\circ\) so \(\bigtriangleup \) opt \(\cong \) \(\bigtriangleup \) otq
\(\Rightarrow pt=tq\)
In right angle triangle(opt) we have sin\(30^\circ=\frac {pt}r=0.5\Rightarrow pq=2 \times pt=_{k}_\)
similarly cos\(30^\circ=\frac {ot}r\Rightarrow ot=_{{Decimal('0.866')*k}}_\)
area of the \(\bigtriangleup opq = \frac 12 \times pq \times ot=_{{(Decimal('0.5')*k*Decimal('0.866')*k)}}_\)
area of the segment =_{{trunc(pi_val*k*k*1/6,2)}}_ - _{{trunc(Decimal('0.5')*k*Decimal('0.866')*k,2)}}_
\(\Rightarrow _{{trunc(pi_val*k*k*1/6-(Decimal('0.5')*k*Decimal('0.866')*k),2)}}_\)
